gw.processes

Interface BatchProcess

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BatchProcessBase, com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.MultiPhaseBatchProcess, com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess

    public interface BatchProcess
    Interface for a BatchProcess that can be managed by a BatchProcessManager. A BatchProcess can expect to be launched in a newly-created thread, and will generally be provided with a callback that should be called upon completion.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkInitialConditions()
      Checks the conditions necessary for this batch process to run, such as server runlevels.
      java.lang.String getDetailedStatus()
      Returns a detailed description of the status, which is useful when integers are not good enough
      int getOperationsCompleted() 
      int getOperationsExpected() 
      int getOperationsFailed() 
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOperationsFailedReasons() 
      ProcessHistory getProcessHistory() 
      java.lang.String getProgress() 
      BatchProcessType getType()
      Returns the type of this batch process.
      boolean isExclusive()
      Returns whehter another batch process can be launched while this batch process is running.
      boolean isFinished()
      Asks if the process has completed or not.
      boolean requestTermination()
      Request that the process terminate.
      void run()
      Start the process.
      void setProcessHistory(ProcessHistory processHistory)
      Sets the ProcessHistory entity associated with this batch process

    • Method Detail

      • checkInitialConditions

        boolean checkInitialConditions()
        Checks the conditions necessary for this batch process to run, such as server runlevels. If the initial conditions are not met, this method should return false.

      • isExclusive

        boolean isExclusive()
        Returns whehter another batch process can be launched while this batch process is running.

      • run

        void run()
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Start the process. The process should continue to run until completion or until the stop method is called.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the process receives a terminate call.

      • requestTermination

        boolean requestTermination()
        Request that the process terminate. The process should exit after completion of its next operation and its run method must throw an InterruptedException. Note that after this method returns the process has not yet terminated. This method should be non-blocking.
        Returns:
        true if the process could be successfully terminated, false if it could not

      • getType

        BatchProcessType getType()
        Returns the type of this batch process.
        Returns:
        the type of batch process

      • getOperationsCompleted

        int getOperationsCompleted()
        Returns:
        The number of units of work completed by the batch process, including failed units.

      • getOperationsExpected

        int getOperationsExpected()
        Returns:
        The number of units of work expected to be completed by the batch process.

      • getOperationsFailed

        int getOperationsFailed()
        Returns:
        The number of units of work that failed processing.

      • getOperationsFailedReasons

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOperationsFailedReasons()
        Returns:
        The list of failure reasons of units of work that failed processing (size of the list should match the number of getOperationsFailed().

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished()
        Asks if the process has completed or not. Completion says nothing about the error state of the process.
        Returns:
        true if the process has completed or false if not

      • getProgress

        java.lang.String getProgress()
        Returns:
        a string in the form "x of y" where 'x' is the amount of work completed and 'y' is the total amount of work. If 'y' is unknown, returns just "x".

      • getDetailedStatus

        java.lang.String getDetailedStatus()
        Returns a detailed description of the status, which is useful when integers are not good enough
        Returns:
        Detailed description

      • getProcessHistory

        ProcessHistory getProcessHistory()
        Returns:
        The ProcessHistory entity associated with this batch process

      • setProcessHistory

        void setProcessHistory(ProcessHistory processHistory)
        Sets the ProcessHistory entity associated with this batch process
